intro: Brassica campestris f. spontanea, commonly known as wild mustard, is a wild variety of the cabbage family. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers in clusters. It is known for its strong mustard odor and is often considered a weed. This species is native to Europe and Asia but has been introduced to many other regions.
